mosimage.caption: The crack spotted on Chingrighata Flyover. Source: Bong Life/ YouTube

story.storykicker: Panic spread quickly after passers-by noticed a prominent fissure running down the side of Chingrighata Flyover, another major overpass in Kolkata.
story.storybody:
Not too long ago, Kolkata woke up to the horror of a crumbling flyover; Vivekananda Flyover collapsed upon the highly-populated locality of Girish Park, taking over 27 lives and injuring several more.

The city hadn't recovered from this tragedy yet when Chingrighata Flyover, another major overpass in Kolkata, flashed a huge crack running down its sides.

Panic spread quickly after passers-by noticed the fissure yesterday afternoon. Officials were immediately contacted to inspect the busy flyover which connects South Kolkata's EM Bypass to Salt Lake City.

Unlike Vivekananda Flyover, which was under construction when it collapsed, Chingrighata Flyover is a regular route for several daily commuters and a carrier of heavy traffic. Hence, the fear triggered at the sight of the crack here was double.

However, upon inspection, officials said the crack was not dangerous.

{mosimage}


The crack is 'quite natural': KMDA

The Kolkata Metropolitan Development Authority (KMDA) confirmed that the fissure on Chingrighata Flyover's side-wall was not a big damage and cannot cause the bridge to collapse.

After checking the entire structure for damage, a senior engineer of KMDA said the crack was "very common and quite natural too."

"The crack was created, might be due to weather-change, on the outside plaster on an expansion joint between two girders, not on the main structure of the flyover," he said. "A very minimum repairing is required there."

He added that there is "no possibility of Chingrighata Flyover's collapse." The restriction too was lifted within hours, allowing traffic to flow back and forth over the big-black crack.

Ei Samay, on the other hand, reports that more than one cracks were spotted on the flyover.

YouTube channel Bong Life uploaded this video clip of the fissure distinctly visible from across the road:

briefcase_content.briefcase: The crack runs down the side of the flyover's wall.
Officials said it is not a big damage and is "very common".
